class.name: CameraServer
class.brief_description: Server keeping track of different cameras accessible in Godot.
class.description: The [CameraServer] keeps track of different cameras accessible in Pandemonium. These are external cameras such as webcams or the cameras on your phone. It is notably used to provide AR modules with a video feed from the camera. [b]Note:[/b] This class is currently only implemented on Linux, Android, macOS, and iOS. On other platforms no [CameraFeed]s will be available. To get a [CameraFeed] on iOS, the camera plugin from [url=https://github.com/godotengine/godot-ios-plugins]godot-ios-plugins[/url] is required.

method.name: add_feed
method.description: Adds the camera feed to the camera server.

method.name: get_feed
method.description: Returns the [CameraFeed] corresponding to the camera with the given index.

signal.name: camera_feed_added
signal.description: Emitted when a [CameraFeed] is added (e.g. a webcam is plugged in).

signal.name: camera_feed_removed
signal.description: Emitted when a [CameraFeed] is removed (e.g. a webcam is unplugged).

signal.name: camera_feeds_updated
signal.description: Emitted when camera feeds are updated.
